tit.e: Soshu Hojutsu Chorenjo (gunnery practice field of Sagami province in the Edo period)
Soshu Hojutsu Chorenjo (gunnery practice field of Sagami Province in the Edo period)
Soshu Hojutsu Chorenjo (gunnery practice field of Sagami Province in the Edo period)

sen.j: 相州炮術調練場（そしゅうほうじゅつちょうれんじょう）は、現在の神奈川県藤沢市および茅ヶ崎市の海岸にあった、江戸時代の銃術鍛練場。
sen.e: Soshu Hojutsu Chorenjo refers to a gunnery practice field in the Edo period located on the seashore in Fujisawa City and Chigasaki City, Kanagawa Prefecture at present.

Soshu Hojutsu Chorenjo refers to a gunnery practice field in the Edo period located on the seashore in Fujisawa City and Chigasaki City, an area that is now within the boundary of Kanagawa Prefecture.

Soshu Hojutsu Chorenjo refers to a gunnery practice field in the Edo period located on the seashore in Fujisawa City and Chigasaki City, an area that is now within the boundary of Kanagawa Prefecture.

sen.j: 1590年（天正18年） - 現在の藤沢市および茅ヶ崎市の海岸が天領となり、藤沢宿藤沢宿代官が管理する。
sen.e: In 1590, the seashore in present-day Fujisawa City and Chigasaki City became a shogunal demesne, and Fujisawa-shuku Station was administered by a local governor.
In 1590, the seashore in what is now Fujisawa City and Chigasaki City became a shogunal demesne, and Fujisawa-shuku Station was administered by a local governor.
In 1590, the seashore in what is now Fujisawa City and Chigasaki City became a shogunal demesne, and Fujisawa-shuku Station was administered by a local governor.

sen.j: 1728年（享保13年） - 享保の改革の一環で、幕府鉄炮方の井上左太夫貞高が、鉄炮方役人の銃術鍛練の場として、柳島村（相模川河口）から片瀬村までの海岸に、相州炮術調練場を設置する。
sen.e: In 1728, as a part of the Kyoho Reforms, Sadayu Sadataka INOUE (the govenment official of Teppo Kata of the Tokugawa Shogunate) established Soshu Hojutsu Chorenjo, a shooting practice field for government officers of Bakufu teppo kata (the gun division of the Tokugawa Shogunate) in the seashore from Yanajima Village (the mouth of Sagami-gawa River) to Katase Village.

In 1728, as part of the Kyoho reforms, Sadayu Sadataka INOUE (the govenment official of Teppo Kata of the Tokugawa shogunate) established Soshu Hojutsu Chorenjo, a shooting practice field for government officers of Bakufu teppo kata (the gun division of the Tokugawa shogunate) in the seashore from Yanajima Village (the mouth of the Sagami-gawa River) to Katase Village.

In 1728, as part of the Kyoho reforms, Sadayu Sadataka INOUE (the government official of Teppo Kata of the Tokugawa shogunate) established Soshu Hojutsu Chorenjo, a shooting practice field for government officers of Bakufu teppo kata (the gun division of the Tokugawa shogunate) in the seashore from Yanajima Village (the mouth of the Sagami-gawa River) to Katase Village.
sen.cmt: 一つ目のgovenmentをgovernmentに変更しました。

sen.j: 1738年（元文3年）10月18日 - 幕府が、役職として大筒役を新設。
sen.e: On October 18, 1738, the bakufu newly established the odutsu yaku (office of artillery) as a managing post.
On October 18, 1738, the bakufu established the odutsu yaku (office of artillery) as a managing post.
On October 18, 1738, the bakufu established the ozutsu yaku (office of artillery) as a managing post.

sen.j: 1766年（明和3年）11月18日 - 腰越村と西で接している片瀬村の村役人が、炮術調練場の延伸に反対する訴状を提出。
sen.e: On November 18, 1766, the village official of Katase Village, bordered on the west by Koshigoe Village, submitted the petition opposing to extension of the shooting practice field.
On November 18, 1766, the village official of Katase Village, bordered on the west by Koshigoe Village, submitted a petition opposing the extension of the shooting practice field.
On November 18, 1766, the village official of Katase Village, bordered on the west by Koshigoe Village, submitted a petition opposing the extension of the shooting practice field.

sen.j: 結果、炮術調練場は延伸するが、当面は訓練を行わないことで、幕府と住民が合意。
sen.e: As a result, although the shooting practice field was extended, bakufu and residents agreed on not using it for shooting for the time being.
As a result, although the shooting practice field was extended, the bakufu and residents agreed that it wouldn't be used for shooting for the time being.
As a result, although the shooting practice field was extended, the bakufu and residents agreed that it wouldn't be used for shooting for the time being.

sen.j: 1824年（文政7年） - 佐々木卯之助が、本調練場の責任者である、幕府大筒役となる。
sen.e: In 1824, the Unosuke SASAKI became a bakufu odutsu yaku who was in charge of the shooting practice field.
In 1824, the Unosuke SASAKI became a bakufu odutsu yaku in charge of the shooting practice field.
In 1824, the Unosuke SASAKI became a bakufu ozutsu yaku in charge of the shooting practice field.

sen.j: 1835年（天保6年）12月 - 炮術調練場の責任者である、幕府大筒役の佐々木卯之助が、評定所から青ヶ島遠島（流刑）の判決を受ける。
sen.e: In December 1835, Unosuke SASAKI, who was in charge of the shooting practice field, was sentenced to be exiled to Aogashima Island by Hyojosho (conference chamber).
In December 1835, Unosuke SASAKI, who was in charge of the shooting practice field, was sentenced to be exiled to Aogashima Island by the Hyojosho (conference chamber).
In December 1835, Unosuke SASAKI, who was in charge of the shooting practice field, was sentenced to be exiled to Aogashima Island by the Hyojosho (conference chamber).

sen.j: 1838年（天保9年） - 江戸幕府が、調練場内の田畑の休耕を命じる。
sen.e: In 1838, the Edo bakufu ordered leave farmland in the shooting practice field fallow.
In 1838, the Edo bakufu ordered that farmland in the shooting practice field be left fallow.
In 1838, the Edo bakufu ordered that farmland in the shooting practice field be left fallow.

sen.j: 1850年（嘉永3年） - 片瀬村、鵠沼村および辻堂村に鉄炮場を増設する。
sen.e: In 1850, the shooting practice field was extended to Katase Village, Kugenuma Village and Tsujido Village.
In 1850, the shooting practice field was extended to the Katase, Kugenuma and Tsujido villages.
In 1850, the shooting practice field was extended to the Katase, Kugenuma and Tsujido villages.

sen.j: 1868年（明治元年） - 鉄炮場を廃止。
sen.e: In 1868 (the first year of Meiji Period), the shooting practice field was abolished.
In 1868 (the first year of Meiji Period), the shooting practice field was abolished.
In 1868 (the first year of Meiji Period), the shooting practice field was abolished.

sen.j: 後に同地は、横須賀海軍砲術学校辻堂演習場となる。
sen.e: The field served as the Tsujido maneuver range of Yokosuka navy gunnery school afterwards.
sen.cmt: 横須賀海軍砲術学校辻堂演習場：定訳不明
sen.e: Subsequently, the field served as the Tsujido maneuvering range of the Yokosuka naval gunnery school.
Subsequently, the field served as the Tsujido maneuvering range of the Yokosuka naval gunnery school.

sen.j: 境川 (東京都・神奈川県)河口から引地川に挟まれた鵠沼村の南東部（25万坪余）は、大給松平家（後の大給子爵家）近道氏が入手した。
sen.e: Chikamichi Clan of Ogyu Matsudaira family (later Ogyu Viscount family) possessed the southeastern area (about 826,400 square meters) of Kugenuma Village, located between the mouth of Sakai-gawa River (Tokyo and Kanagawa Prefecture) and Hikiji-gawa River.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。大給松平家（後の大給子爵家）近道氏：定訳不明250000 坪 ＝ 826400 m2
sen.e: The Chikamichi clan of the Ogyu Matsudaira family (later the Viscount Ogyu family) possessed the southeastern area (about 826,400 square meters) of Kugenuma Village, located between the mouth of the Sakai-gawa River (Tokyo and Kanagawa Prefecture) and the Hikiji-gawa River.

The Chikamichi clan of the Ogyu Matsudaira family (later the Viscount Ogyu family) possessed the southeastern area (about 826,400 square meters) of Kugenuma Village, located between the mouth of the Sakai-gawa River (Tokyo and Kanagawa Prefecture) and the Hikiji-gawa River.

sen.j: 鉄道開通を機に日本初の別荘分譲地（鵠沼海岸別荘地）として開発された。
sen.e: At the opening of railroad, the land was developed as the first cottage subdivision lots for sale in Japan (Kugenuma-Kaigan Villas).
sen.cmt: 鵠沼海岸別荘地：定訳不明一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: Upon the opening of railroad, the land was developed as the first cottage subdivision lots for sale in Japan (Kugenuma-Kaigan Villas).
Upon the opening of railroad, the land was developed as the first cottage subdivision lots for sale in Japan (Kugenuma-Kaigan Villas).

sen.j: 辻堂村西部は、大日本帝国海軍の横須賀海軍砲術学校辻堂演習場となった。
sen.e: The western part of Tsujido Village became the Tsujido maneuver range of Yokosuka navy gunnery school of Imperial Japanese Navy.
sen.cmt: 横須賀海軍砲術学校辻堂演習場：定訳不明
sen.e: The western part of Tsujido Village became the Tsujido maneuvering range of the Yokosuka naval gunnery school of the Imperial Japanese Navy.
The western part of Tsujido Village became the Tsujido maneuvering range of the Yokosuka naval gunnery school of the Imperial Japanese Navy.

sen.j: 横須賀海軍砲術学校辻堂演習場は太平洋戦争後は在日米海軍辻堂演習場として接収された。
sen.e: Tsujido maneuver range of Yokosuka navy gunnery school was requisitioned as Tsujido maneuver range of US Navy Japan after the Pacific War.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: The Tsujido maneuvering range of the Yokosuka naval gunnery school was requisitioned as the Tsujido maneuvering range of the US Navy in Japan after the Pacific War.
The Tsujido maneuvering range of the Yokosuka naval gunnery school was requisitioned as the Tsujido maneuvering range of the US Navy in Japan after the Pacific War.

sen.j: 朝鮮戦争の際には敵前上陸の演習が行われた。
sen.e: Opposed landing maneuver was held there at the Korean War.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: Opposed landing maneuvers were held there during the Korean War.
Opposed landing maneuvers were held there during the Korean War.

sen.j: この演習により、ダグラス・マッカーサーは仁川上陸作戦を成功させたといわれる。
sen.e: It is said that this maneuver led Douglas MacArthur's Incheon Landing Operation success.
It is said that those maneuvers led to the success of General Douglas MacArthur's Incheon landing operation.
It is said that those maneuvers led to the success of General Douglas MacArthur's Incheon landing operation.

sen.j: 演習場が返還されたのは1959年である。
sen.e: In 1959, the maneuver range was returned to Japan.
In 1959, the maneuver range was returned to Japan.
In 1959, the maneuver range was returned to Japan.

sen.j: 跡地には日本住宅公団の辻堂団地、湘南工科大学、松下政経塾、神奈川県立辻堂海浜公園などが立地した。
sen.e: The Tsujido housing development of the Japan Housing Corporation, Shonan Institute of Technology, Matsushita Institute of Government and Management, Kanagawa prefectural Tsujido Seaside Park, etc. had been located at the site.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: The Tsujido housing development of the Japan Housing Corporation, Shonan Institute of Technology, Matsushita Institute of Government and Management, Kanagawa Prefectural Tsujido Seaside Park, etc., had been located at the site.

The Tsujido housing development of the Japan Housing Corporation, Shonan Institute of Technology, Matsushita Institute of Government and Management, Kanagawa Prefectural Tsujido Seaside Park, etc., had been located at the site.

sen.j: 海岸部を国道134号が通過している（演習場時代は北側を迂回していた）。
sen.e: The National Route 134 passes the seashore area (it was detoured through north side in the maneuver range days).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: National Route 134 passes the seashore area (it was detoured through the north side in the days of the maneuvering range).
National Route 134 passes the seashore area (it was detoured through the north side in the days of the maneuvering range).

sen.j: 運営
sen.e: Management
Management
Management

sen.j: 井上左太夫貞高（幕府鉄砲方）と、江川太郎左衛門（当主）と、鉄砲場見廻役（地元住民）で運営した。
sen.e: It was managed by Sadayu Sadataka INOUE (the govenment official of Teppo Kata), Tarozaemon EGAWA (family head) and the patrolmen of the firing range (local residents).
It was managed by Sadayu Sadataka INOUE (the govenment official of Teppo Kata), Tarozaemon EGAWA (family head) and the patrolmen of the firing range (local residents).
It was managed by Sadayu Sadataka INOUE (the government official of Teppo Kata), Tarozaemon EGAWA (family head) and the patrolmen of the firing range (local residents).
sen.cmt: govenmentをgovernment に変更しました。

sen.j: 鉄砲場見廻役は、地元の村々の名主などから任命された。
sen.e: The patrolmen of the firing range were assigned by the local village headman, etc.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: The patrolmen of the firing range were assigned by the head of the local village, etc.
The patrolmen of the firing range were assigned by the head of the local village, etc.

sen.j: その役目の重要性から苗字帯刀を許されていた。
sen.e: They were allowed to adopt a surname and wear a pair of swords because of the importance of their role.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: Because of the importance of their role, they were allowed to adopt surnames and wear pairs of swords.
Because of the importance of their role, they were allowed to adopt surnames and wear pairs of swords.

sen.j: 彼らから夫役を命じられたのは三浦郡、鎌倉郡および高座郡の村々であった。
sen.e: Villages in Miura-gun County, Kamakura-gun County and Koza-gun County were ordered compulsory service by them.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: Villages in Miura-gun County, Kamakura-gun County and Koza-gun County were ordered into compulsory service by them.
Villages in Miura-gun County, Kamakura-gun County and Koza-gun County were ordered into compulsory service by them.

sen.j: 演習の時期になると役人の宿泊接待、力役労働、警備、伝馬などの夫役を負担させられた。
sen.e: When the period of the maneuver came, these villages were made to pay compulsory service, such as a accommodation service for government officials, manual labor, guard and post horse.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: When the period for maneuvers came, these villages were made to pay compulsory service, such as by providing accommodations for government officials or serving in manual labor, guard and horse-related posts.

When the period for maneuvers came, these villages were made to pay compulsory service, such as by providing accommodations for government officials or serving in manual labor, guard and horse-related posts.

sen.j: 周辺の村々は、通常から戸塚宿、藤沢宿および平塚宿の助郷を命じられていた。
sen.e: The surrounding villages were already ordered sukego (labor which was imposed to the neighboring village to help the primarily imposed village) for Totsuka-juku Station, Fujisawa-shuku Station and Hiratsuka-juku Station.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: The surrounding villages were already ordered into sukego (labor that was imposed upon the neighboring village to help the primarily imposed village) for Totsuka-juku Station, Fujisawa-shuku Station and Hiratsuka-juku Station.

The surrounding villages were already ordered into sukego (labor that was imposed upon the neighboring village to help the primarily imposed village) for Totsuka-juku Station, Fujisawa-shuku Station and Hiratsuka-juku Station.

sen.j: そのため彼らは困窮しており、炮術調練場の賦役は大きな負担となっていた。
sen.e: Therefore, they were destitute, and fueki (slave labor) for the shooting practice field was huge burden.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: Thus they were destitute, and fueki (slave labor) for the shooting practice field was a huge burden.
Thus they were destitute, and fueki (slave labor) for the shooting practice field was a huge burden.

sen.j: 演習頻度
sen.e: The frequency of the maneuvers
The frequency of maneuvers
The frequency of maneuvers

sen.j: 1728年（享保13年）-1748年(寛延元年) - 毎年演習を行う。
sen.e: From 1728 to 1748, the maneuvers were held every year.
From 1728 to 1748, the maneuvers were held each year.
From 1728 to 1748, the maneuvers were held each year.

sen.j: 1750年（寛延3年）-1774年（安永3年） - 隔年で演習を行う。
sen.e: From 1750 to 1774, the maneuvers were held every other year.
From 1750 to 1774, the maneuvers were held every other year.
From 1750 to 1774, the maneuvers were held every other year.

sen.j: 1775年（安永4年）以降 - 最低隔年で演習を行う。
sen.e: After 1775, the maneuvers were held at least every other year.
After 1775, the maneuvers were held at least every other year.
After 1775, the maneuvers were held at least every other year.

sen.j: 演習期間
sen.e: Maneuver period
The period of maneuvers
The period of maneuvers

sen.j: 7組程度に分かれ、各組が16日から25日間、4月上旬から7月中旬に断続的に行う。
sen.e: They were divided into about seven groups, and each group maneuvered intermittently from the beginning of April to mid-July for 16 to 25 days.
They were divided into about seven groups, and each group maneuvered intermittently from the beginning of April to mid-July for 16 to 25 days.
They were divided into about seven groups, and each group maneuvered intermittently from the beginning of April to mid-July for 16 to 25 days.

sen.j: 江戸から参加する役人は、往復各2日間を加えて、20日から1ヶ月間の出張となる。
sen.e: The government official who participates from Edo needed from 20 days to one month including two days for coming and another two days for returning trip.
The government official participant from Edo needed from 20 days to one month, including two days each for the arrival and departure stages of the trip.
The government official participant from Edo needed from 20 days to one month, including two days each for the arrival and departure stages of the trip.

sen.j: 風雨の日は順延するため、秋口まで演習が行うこともある。
sen.e: Since the maneuver was postponed when it was windy or rained, the maneuver period might be held until the beginning of autumn.
Because the maneuvers were postponed when it was windy or rainy, the period for maneuvers might be held until the beginning of autumn.
Because the maneuvers were postponed when it was windy or rainy, the period for maneuvers might be held until the beginning of autumn.

sen.j: 演習内容
sen.e: The details of the maneuvers
The details of the maneuvers
The details of the maneuvers

sen.j: 町打（ちょううち）、角打、船打および下ケ矢などがあった。
sen.e: There were chouchi (long distance shooting practice), short range shooting practice, shooting practice on board, shimogaya (downward shooting practice from a high place), etc.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: There were chouchi (long-distance shooting practice), short-range shooting practice, shooting practice on board, shimogaya (downward shooting practice from a high place), etc.
There were chouchi (long-distance shooting practice), short-range shooting practice, shooting practice on board, shimogaya (downward shooting practice from a high place), etc.

sen.j: それぞれ発射場、射撃目標が決まっていた。
sen.e: The launching site and the target were settled, respectively.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: The launch site and the target were settled, respectively.
The launch site and the target were settled, respectively.

sen.j: 町打
sen.e: Chouchi
Chouchi
Chouchi

sen.j: 遠距離射撃訓練。
sen.e: Long distance shooting practice.
Long-distance shooting practice
Long-distance shooting practice

sen.j: 辻堂海岸に発射場および打小屋を置いた。
sen.e: A launching site and shooting cabin were placed on the Tsujido seashore.
A launch site and shooting cabin were placed on the Tsujido seashore.
A launch site and shooting cabin were placed on the Tsujido seashore.

sen.j: 射撃目標は、柳島村の海岸とした。
sen.e: The target was set to the seashore in Yanajima-mura Village.
The target was set as the seashore in Yanajima-mura Village.
The target was set as the seashore in Yanajima-mura Village.

sen.j: 大筒稽古では、烏帽子岩も標的とした。
sen.e: Eboshi-iwa Rock was also the target at ozutsu (Japanese artillery) practice.
Eboshi-iwa Rock was also the target at ozutsu (Japanese artillery) practice.
Eboshi-iwa Rock was also the target at ozutsu (Japanese artillery) practice.

sen.j: 角打
sen.e: Short range shooting practice
Short-range shooting practice
Short-range shooting practice

sen.j: 近距離射撃訓練。
sen.e: Short range shooting practice.
Short-range shooting practice
Short-range shooting practice

sen.j: 鵠沼海岸で行われた。
sen.e: It is held in Kugenuma-Kaigan seashore.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: It was held at the Kugenuma-Kaigan seashore.
It was held at the Kugenuma-Kaigan seashore.

sen.j: 打場から一町ごとに定杭を打った。
sen.e: Stakes were put every 109 meter from the shooting site.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: Stakes were placed at intervals of 109 meters from the shooting site.
Stakes were placed at intervals of 109 meters from the shooting site.

sen.j: 発射のたびに着弾地点を特定して飛弾距離を測定した。
sen.e: An impact area was pinpointed at every launching and the shooting distance was measured.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: An impact area was pinpointed at every launch, and the shooting distance was measured.
An impact area was pinpointed at every launch, and the shooting distance was measured.

sen.j: 船打
sen.e: Shooting practice on board
Shooting practice on board
Shooting practice on board

sen.j: 船上射撃訓練。
sen.e: Shooting practice on board.
Shooting practice on board
Shooting practice on board

sen.j: 地元の漁船小船3艘と、三百石船1艘を借り、船上から射撃訓練をした。
sen.e: Three small local fishing boat and one ship which can carry 300 Koku (about 83.4 cubic meters) was chartered, and onboard range practice was held.
Three small local fishing boats and one ship, which could carry 300 koku (about 83.4 cubic meters), was chartered, and onboard range practice was held.
Three small local fishing boats and one ship, which could carry 300 koku (about 83.4 cubic meters), was chartered, and onboard range practice was held.

sen.j: 下ケ矢
sen.e: Shimogaya
Shimogaya
Shimogaya

sen.j: 高所から下方へ打つ訓練。
sen.e: Downward shooting practice from a high place.
Downward shooting practice from a high place
Downward shooting practice from a high place

sen.j: 片瀬村駒立山から下方に打ち下ろした。
sen.e: Downward shooting practices were held from Katase-mura Village Komatate-yama Hill.
Downward shooting practice sessions were held from Komatate-yama Hill, in Katase-mura Village.
Downward shooting practice sessions were held from Komatate-yama Hill, in Katase-mura Village.
